title.narrative: NUTRITION IN EMERGENCY

description.narrative: as per HAC plan, which contributes to Early Detection And Treatment Of Malnutrition, Early Detection And Treatment Of Malnutrition (Covid), Nutrition In Early Childhood, Nutrition In Early Childhood (Covid), Nutrition Of Adolescents And Women. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Community Engagement, Social And Behaviour Change, Data, Research, Evaluation And Knowledge Management, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2022, adolescent girls, women of childbearing age (especially pregnant and breastfeeding women) and their children aged 0-59 months adopt better nutrition practices and use quality nutrition-specific and sensitive services.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: as per HAC plan

description.narrative: The security situation deteriorated significantly during the year 2021, with a reduction in humanitarian access, mainly in the six most affected regions: Nord, Centre-Nord, Sahel, Est, Boucle du Mouhoun, Centre-Est. In the six emergency regions, 54,907 SAM children were admitted to therapeutic feeding programs. 448,733 pregnant and lactating women benefited from IYCF counselling, 94,866 mothers were trained in the screening of acute malnutrition by home brachial perimeter through a partnership signed with the NGO ALIMA in the health district of Barsalogho and 1,741,430 children aged 6-59 months received vitamin A supplementation (96.5 per cent) during VAS days. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:28/01/2022
